text: Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online. Is it hot where you live? It sure is in SC. It’s not just a July heatwave, but an entire summer so far heatwave on steroids – which makes it hard to enjoy doing much outside between the hours of 9AM – 7PM. One way Ed and I have been beating the heat has been taking advantage of half-priced Tuesdays at the movie theater. It is so cold in the theaters sometimes that you need to bring a sweater or a blanket to stay warm…. which I do. Ed just rolls his eyes at me when I bring my movie throw blanket with me. I make sure to point out to him that I am not the only one who does this. I see many others heading into the theater with blankets and throws, just like the couple sitting next to me this past Tuesday. Each of them had a colorful crocheted throw covering them up. This past week we saw Superman. If you haven’t seen it, it has a great storyline with heart. I thought it was well done and enjoyed it all the way until the last of the credits scrolled by. How about you – do you bring a sweater or blanket to the movie theater in the summer months so you don’t freeze while watching a movie? Now onto the links I found for you this week. Posts You May Have Missed This Week: SW Dress Blues for My New Kitchen Island (open in same tab) Something to Think About Denmark’s number 1 secret to happiness. The author says it truly changed her life.” (open in same tab) “Your home is an extension of your energy field. This is why practices like cleaning your home, rearranging furniture, organizing your closet, and getting rid of objects that are cluttering up your space can have a profound impact on your body, mind and spirit” – Maryam Hasnaa Oh… So Stylish Finds As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases. With the heatwave we are experiencing, it is hard to imagine fall arriving. I love this shirt and ordered it while it is on sale to wear this fall. I love the feminine detail. (open in same tab) This looks great on a kitchen counter or a dining room buffet. (open in same tab) I used to use a facial cleansing system made by Neutrogena. It stopped working so my sister got me one of these to replace it. love using it as my skin looks so nice after using it. (open in same tab) I have been using this for years and have shared it with you in the past. I love the smell and always make sure I have a backup on hand for when I run out. (open in same tab) If you enjoy these posts – You can find past Style Scouting posts here. And… If you’re catching up on blog posts you may have missed, be sure to sign-up to get my newest posts via email to stay up to date with everything that’s happening here on the blog and more. html:
Thanks for stopping by for this week’s Style Scouting. My Sunday post where I share the random stuff that captured my attention or inspired me that I found online.

Is it hot where you live? It sure is in SC. It’s not just a July heatwave, but an entire summer so far heatwave on steroids – which makes it hard to enjoy doing much outside between the hours of 9AM – 7PM.

One way Ed and I have been beating the heat has been taking advantage of half-priced Tuesdays at the movie theater. It is so cold in the theaters sometimes that you need to bring a sweater or a blanket to stay warm…. which I do.

Ed just rolls his eyes at me when I bring my movie throw blanket with me. I make sure to point out to him that I am not the only one who does this. I see many others heading into the theater with blankets and throws, just like the couple sitting next to me this past Tuesday. Each of them had a colorful crocheted throw covering them up.

This past week we saw Superman. If you haven’t seen it, it has a great storyline with heart. I thought it was well done and enjoyed it all the way until the last of the credits scrolled by.

How about you – do you bring a sweater or blanket to the movie theater in the summer months so you don’t freeze while watching a movie?


Now onto the links I found for you this week.

Posts You May Have Missed This Week:

  • SW Dress Blues for My New Kitchen Island (open in same tab)

Something to Think About


Denmark’s number 1 secret to happiness. The author says it truly changed her life.” (open in same tab)

“Your home is an extension of your energy field. This is why practices like cleaning your home, rearranging furniture, organizing your closet, and getting rid of objects that are cluttering up your space can have a profound impact on your body, mind and spirit” – Maryam Hasnaa

Oh… So Stylish Finds

As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.

  • With the heatwave we are experiencing, it is hard to imagine fall arriving. I love this shirt and ordered it while it is on sale to wear this fall. I love the feminine detail. (open in same tab)
  • This looks great on a kitchen counter or a dining room buffet. (open in same tab)
  • I used to use a facial cleansing system made by Neutrogena. It stopped working so my sister got me one of these to replace it. love using it as my skin looks so nice after using it. (open in same tab)
  • I have been using this for years and have shared it with you in the past. I love the smell and always make sure I have a backup on hand for when I run out. (open in same tab)

If you enjoy these posts – You can find past Style Scouting posts here.

And… If you’re catching up on blog posts you may have missed, be sure to sign-up to get my newest posts via email to stay up to date with everything that’s happening here on the blog and more.
